Authors: Zheng Wang, David S. Hibbett, Manfred Binder
Title:
A new species of Cudonia based on mophological and molecular
data.
Keywords:
Chinese fungi; Geoglossaceae; Helotiales; ITS; Leotiaceae;
nuc-lsu rDNA; Spathulariopsis
Abstract:
A discomycete collected in western Sichuan, China, is
morphologically intermediate between Cudonia and Spathularia. The fungus
has a bright yellow capitate ascigerous head, a white, ridged stalk, and
a well-developed membrane covering the whole ascoma. The asci,
ascospores, and paraphyses are similar to those of Cudonia and
Spathularia. Based on morphology and DNA sequence analysis, a new
species, Cudonia sichuanensis, is reported. Cudonia and Spathularia are
closely related to members of Rhytismataceae, as has been suggested
previously. The similarity of ascoma and ascospore development between
these two genera and Lophodermium (Rhytismataceae) is discussed.
